title: A R package to access the medinfo API.
A R package to access the medinfo API.
code: # single interaction check pzns <- c("03041347", "05538454", "13880764", "00189747", "01970060", "00054065", "17145955", "00592733", "13981502") ddis <- api_interaction_pzn(creds, pzns) print(ddis)  # batch interaction check pzn_batches <- list(   list(     pzns = c("13592031", "00007350"),     id = 1,     details = TRUE   ),   list(     pzns = c("03041347", "05538454", "13880764", "00189747", "01970060", "00054065", "17145955", "00592733", "13981502"),     id = 2,     details = TRUE   ) ) res <- api_interaction_pzn_batch(creds, pzn_batches) print(res)

title: ApiCredentials: API Authentication Credentials — ApiCredentials
text: R6 class manages API authentication credentials, including token storage, expiration checks, token refreshing.

title: ApiCredentials: API Authentication Credentials — ApiCredentials
text: access_token Access token API authentication. refresh_token Refresh token obtaining new access token. token_type Type token, usually "Bearer". access_expires_in Timestamp access token expires. refresh_expires_in Timestamp refresh token expires. role User role assigned API (e.g., "admin"). last_login Timestamp last successful login. host API base URL. Initialize API credentials.

title: ApiCredentials: API Authentication Credentials — ApiCredentials
text: ApiCredentials$new() ApiCredentials$access_token_valid() ApiCredentials$refresh_token_valid() ApiCredentials$refresh() ApiCredentials$print() ApiCredentials$clone()

title: ApiCredentials: API Authentication Credentials — ApiCredentials
code: ApiCredentials$new(   access_token,   refresh_token,   token_type,   access_expires_in,   refresh_expires_in,   role,   last_login,   host )

title: ApiCredentials: API Authentication Credentials — ApiCredentials
text: access_token Access token string. refresh_token Refresh token string. token_type Token type (default: "Bearer"). access_expires_in Expiration timestamp access token. refresh_expires_in Expiration timestamp refresh token. role User role (e.g., "admin"). last_login Timestamp last login. host API base URL.

title: ApiCredentials: API Authentication Credentials — ApiCredentials
text: new ApiCredentials object. Check access token still valid.

title: ApiCredentials: API Authentication Credentials — ApiCredentials
ApiCredentials: API Authentication Credentials — ApiCredentials
text: TRUE access token valid, FALSE otherwise. Check refresh token still valid.

title: ApiCredentials: API Authentication Credentials — ApiCredentials
ApiCredentials: API Authentication Credentials — ApiCredentials
text: TRUE refresh token valid, FALSE otherwise. Refresh API tokens. method updates access token refresh token using refresh token.

title: ApiCredentials: API Authentication Credentials — ApiCredentials
ApiCredentials: API Authentication Credentials — ApiCredentials
text: force Force refresh even access token still valid.

title: ApiCredentials: API Authentication Credentials — ApiCredentials
text: None (updates object fields). Print API credentials (without exposing tokens).

code: # Create an instance with API credentials creds <- ApiCredentials$new(   access_token = "your_access_token",   refresh_token = "your_refresh_token",   token_type = "Bearer",   access_expires_in = "2025-02-26T11:16:04.020256331Z",   refresh_expires_in = "2025-02-27T11:01:04.020409021Z",   role = "admin",   last_login = "2025-02-26T11:00:30Z",   host = "https://medinfo.precisiondosing.de/api/v1" )  # Check token validity creds$access_token_valid() #> [1] FALSE  # Refresh tokens if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ creds$refresh(   "new_access_token", "new_refresh_token",   "2025-03-01T12:00:00Z", "2025-03-02T12:00:00Z" ) } # }
